description._content: Description: A large number of calves were seen near the settlement. These are branded and belong to individual families, being considered a sign of wealth. Location: Tristan Da Cunha Date: 1927 Description: The lighthouse, to the N. Eastward of the settlement. An ordinary oil lamp is burnt every night from sunset to sunrise - visible about four miles. Location: Tristan Da Cunha Date: 1927 Our Catalogue Reference: Part of CO 1069/777 This image is part of the Colonial Office photographic collection held at The National Archives. Feel free to share it within the spirit of the Commons Please use the comments section below the pictures to share any information you have about the people, places or events shown. We have attempted to provide place information for the images automatically but our software may not have found the correct location. For high quality reproductions of any item from our collection please contact our image library
